title: Quick Gameplay Thoughts: October 20
body:
Morning folks,

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------

**Usual Disclaimers**

These posts will often contain talk about future work we're doing, or planning to do, that isn't yet guaranteed to ship. The nature of the work could change or, depending on what we discover, projects mentioned may get put delayed or even stopped.
If you'd like to see a Tweet whenever a new one of these posts goes up: https://twitter.com/RiotMeddler
------------------------------------------------------------------------------

**Zac stuff in testing**

We're trying out some Zac changes at the moment. Goal of those is to make his Q a less powerful spell, through lower reliability in particular, and then buff him in other ways.  Possible changes look like Q having less range and a shorter less break distance, but in exchange Q CD starting on first cast, rather than Q2 or expiration, plus a bit more damage on W. Overall goal would be a slight buff. 

------------------------------------------------------------------------------

**Looking at AP junglers a bit**

We're going to take a look at a couple of AP champs from a jungle perspective, see if we can give them a bit of help. Not sure on timing, given there's some more critical work (runes stuff mainly) that's demanding a lot of work right now, hoping to do some explorations during the next few patches though. That might mean work on AP champs who already jungle, or at least used to in the past, could also mean work on AP champs with play patterns that would be fine in the jungle who just haven't been good enough at clearing historically to do so (e.g. someone like Morg might be a good candidate, Annie given her high reliability when ganking probably not). 


------------------------------------------------------------------------------

**Eve Homeguard Anim**

No promises, but we're looking at potential ways to include the previous Eve Homeguard animation (link below to a video) as a hidden easter egg somehow. It's not the right fit for her primary Homeguard anim, might be able to get it in in some way though.

https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/ojpjB4Kr-hold-on-rito-why-did-you-remove-this-glorious-homeguard-animation-for-eve


------------------------------------------------------------------------------

**Adjusting some skin portraits**

A while back we added distinct portraits to the player's UI based off which skin they had selected. One common piece of feedback on those though was that many of them felt too zoomed in, which looked unnatural or just confusing. We've got a round of revisions to those coming as a result, with around half the portraits adjusted so they're noticeably more zoomed out.



http://ddragon.leagueoflegends.com/cdn/6.24.1/img/champion/Ziggs.png

This is part of a bigger question I have about jungling champions in general, but could you perhaps take a minute to talk about why +/- damage to monsters and unique monster mechanics aren't used more often in champion/item balancing? It seems like it's a great opportunity to get a lot more variety into the jungle and enable some really cool team compositions -- anything from extra damage to damage resistance to monsters to mana restoration seems like a great way to enable interesting junglers without skewing their laning phase.

My initial thought is because, in addition to possibly adding a bit of extra power in specific situations, those statistics can skew perceptions into believing that champion is INTENDED as a jungle pick rather than simply able to be one, but I'd love to know your opinion on the subject.

I'm thinking specifically about unique possible junglers here -- people like Akali, Aurelion Sol, Diana, Fiora, Illaoi, Gnar, Karthus, Lissandra, Malphite, Morgana, Orianna, Renekton, Rumble, Tahm Kench, Taliyah, Vladimir, etc -- characters who may have the AoE damage or the interesting gank possibilities but don't have the power or the sustained damage to survive clears efficiently (or junglers who need a little jungle edge without a power spike).

Hey Meddler, hope your day is going well. Two questions I had about Eve:

1.) Considering Eve’s struggling with closing the gap between her and her target, is there a reason the balance team prioritized damage buffs to her E instead of buffing her base movespeed or giving a small buff to her E and empowered E?

2.) Is Eve even an assassin? She honestly plays more like a slightly more bursty skirmisher. She’s not at all bursty in the same way tha Kha’zix or Rengar or Talon are as true assassins?

We think she's closer to an assassin than any other subclass, agree she's got some skirmisher aspects though certainly. We're cautious about giving her too much target access given her permanent camo post 6 and access to hard CC on a basic spell, both of which are not strengths other assassins (who do tend to have significantly better gap closing) have.

Q as a skillshot for range and waveclear, W as very conditional and telegraphed hard CC, E as a short range gap closer, R as damage and escape tied together.

Is new {{champion:28}} just a different version of {{champion:245}} ?

Not really. Eve's Q is more so for upfront burst damage, and it is all about how fast one can mash Q, after that first skillshot, to stab people with spikes. Ekko uses his Q for waveclear as well, but he has to wait for the extra damage on the rewind. Eve's W is a far more offensive spell than Ekko's W, since its hard CC with shred, as well as single target, instead of hard CC and shield, that's AOE. Eve's is a short ranged gap closer, while Ekko's is actually pretty long ranged, in comparison, 225 to 750. Finally, Eve's ult is damage and escape, or an engage tool, while Ekko's is damage or escape, or a free teleport. While the champions have their similarities, they are very different.

The cost of the perma stealth as it currently exists is just too high when you compare to champs with stonger, shorter-duration stealth. 

Either the stealth itself is too weak or permastealth comes at too high of a penalty to damage *and* mobility.

In my opinion the weakness with AP junglers is the lack of separation between AP items. AD jungle can build a bruiser-like build. ROA doesn't work because of its slow start, Liandry's is meta for everyone, Rylai's is rather niche right now (out of necessity), and protobelt has needed balanced around midlaners as well.

To improve AP junglers, I think there needs to be something in favor of certain bruiser AP items for junglers. Maybe Liandry's burn gets augmented (and a minor one gets added to Haunting Guise) against monsters if you've recently applied one of the echoes procs (which in turn no one builds both except AP junglers), then slightly nerf the AP on the item to compensate.

How Riot could fix Rengar is really hard to say for sure and I really doubt any Rioter has a clear idea of how to go about it without rushing back to the drawing board like they did last time. They want to take their time and make sure they know what they are doing.

It wouldn't take a lot to make Rengar enjoyable again in his current state, like making his Q cancelable by Tiamat (like Renekton's) or even straight-up reverting Q (which would be my preferred option, but I'm sure people will flame me for saying it).

It'd be nice if he even just got a tiny bit of short-term work while Riot works on his rework.

The problem is the current Rengar is worse design wise than the old one so they can't really just buff him. They would need to do a sizable amount of work to bring him into a better state.

Most of that kind of work is on hold while they do runes.
